alert.note: Alert for Decatur; Rawlins; Sheridan; Thomas (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 15 at 5:09PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Thomas, southeastern Rawlins, northwestern Sheridan and southwestern Decatur Counties through 545 PM CDT... At 509 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 6 miles northwest of Selden, or 18 miles southwest of Oberlin, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Thomas, southeastern Rawlins, northwestern Sheridan and southwestern Decatur Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
